model
Class Board

java.lang.Object
  model.Board

public class Board
extends Object

A class for modeling the board of a Tron game. The board is of size getWidth() x getHeight() and has some obstacles on it. You can check if there's an obstacle at position x,y by calling isOccupied(x,y).

Version:
1.1 (17-01-2011)
Author:
Daniel Hessellund Egeberg, Søren Dahlgaard, Martin Nicklas Jørgensen

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a new board with the specified width and height.

getHeight

Returns the height of the board.

Returns:

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Returns the width of the board.

Returns:

isOccupied

public boolean isOccupied(Position position)
Checks if a given position is occupied.

Parameters:
position - The position that need be checked for occupation.
Returns:
A boolean value that shows the occupation of the position. True if the position is occupied, false if it is not.

occupyField

public void occupyField(Position position)
Sets a position as being occupied in the game.

Parameters:
position - The position to occupy.
